description: Modifies a Cedar static policy in the specified policy store. You can change only certain elements of the UpdatePolicyDefinition parameter. You can directly update only static policies. To change a template-linked policy, you must update the template instead, using UpdatePolicyTemplate.

parameters.name: policyStoreId
parameters.description: Specifies the ID of the policy store that contains the policy that you want to update.

parameters.name: policyId
parameters.description: Specifies the ID of the policy that you want to update. To find this value, you can use ListPolicies.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.description: Specifies the updated policy content that you want to replace on the specified policy. The content must be valid Cedar policy language text. You can change only the following elements from the policy definition: The action referenced by the policy. Any conditional clauses, such as when or unless clauses. You can't change the following elements: Changing from static to templateLinked. Changing the effect of the policy from permit or forbid. The principal referenced by the policy. The resource referenced by the policy. static (dict) --- Contains details about the updates to be applied to a static policy. description (string) --- Specifies the description to be added to or replaced on the static policy. Specifies the Cedar policy language text to be added to or replaced on the static policy.

nested_items.name: policyStoreId
nested_items.description: The ID of the policy store that contains the policy that was updated.

nested_items.name: policyId
nested_items.description: The ID of the policy that was updated.

nested_items.name: policyType
nested_items.description: The type of the policy that was updated.

nested_items.name: principal
nested_items.description: The principal specified in the policy's scope. This element isn't included in the response when Principal isn't present in the policy content.

nested_items.name: actions
nested_items.description: The action that a policy permits or forbids. For example, {"actions": [{"actionId": "ViewPhoto", "actionType": "PhotoFlash::Action"}, {"entityID": "SharePhoto", "entityType": "PhotoFlash::Action"}]}.

nested_items.name: createdDate
nested_items.description: The date and time that the policy was originally created.

nested_items.name: lastUpdatedDate
nested_items.description: The date and time that the policy was most recently updated.

nested_items.name: effect
nested_items.description: The effect of the decision that a policy returns to an authorization request. For example, "effect": "Permit".
